intro: Petrophiloides, commonly known as the rock-rose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. These plants are typically found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. They often have small, hairy leaves to reduce water loss and are characterized by their showy, pea-like flowers. The genus includes several species, many of which are native to southern Africa and the Mediterranean region. Petrophiloides species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological importance in stabilizing soil in rocky habitats.
